mainBoard.flavorText: Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug.
mainBoard.name: Beetleback Chief
mainBoard.originalText: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
mainBoard.text: When Beetleback Chief enters, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText: Hunters lure the stripling boar into the open, hoping to trap greater prey.
mainBoard.name: Brindle Shoat
mainBoard.originalText: When Brindle Shoat dies, put a 3/3 green Boar creature token onto the battlefield.
mainBoard.text: When Brindle Shoat dies, create a 3/3 green Boar creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: Swarms thrive in its nest, feeding on leathery bits of discarded wing.
mainBoard.name: Dragonlair Spider
mainBoard.originalText:
Reach
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: The triggered ability will resolve and the Insect will be created before the spell that caused it to trigger resolves.
The triggered ability won’t be affected if the spell that caused it to trigger is countered.

mainBoard.text:
Reach
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, create a 1/1 green Insect creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.
mainBoard.name: Gluttonous Slime

Flash
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
mainBoard.text:
Flash
Devour 1 (As this enters, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

mainBoard.flavorText: A killing machine from birth.
mainBoard.name: Hellkite Hatchling
mainBoard.originalText:
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if it devoured a creature.

rulings.text: Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if at least one creature was sacrificed as a result of the Hatchling's devour ability as it entered. It retains those abilities even if its +1/+1 counters are somehow removed.

If another creature becomes a copy of Hellkite Hatchling (due to Mirrorweave, for example), the second ability checks to see whether that creature — not the original Hellkite Hatchling — devoured a creature as it entered.

mainBoard.text:
Devour 1 (As this enters, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
Hellkite Hatchling has flying and trample if it devoured a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.
mainBoard.name: Hissing Iguanar
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever another creature dies, you may have Hissing Iguanar deal 1 damage to target player.

rulings.text: If Hissing Iguanar dies at the same time as another creature, Hissing Iguanar’s ability triggers.

mainBoard.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may have Hissing Iguanar deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

mainBoard.name: Mitotic Slime
mainBoard.originalText: When Mitotic Slime dies, put two 2/2 green Ooze creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "When this creature dies, put two 1/1 green Ooze creature tokens onto the battlefield."
mainBoard.text: When Mitotic Slime dies, create two 2/2 green Ooze creature tokens. They have "When this creature dies, create two 1/1 green Ooze creature tokens."

mainBoard.flavorText: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.
mainBoard.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
mainBoard.originalText: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Mycoloth
mainBoard.originalText:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each +1/+1 counter on Mycoloth.

rulings.text: If multiple creatures with devour are entering under your control at the same time, you may use each one's devour ability. A creature you already control can be devoured by only one of them, however. (In other words, you can't sacrifice the same creature to satisfy multiple devour abilities.) All creatures devoured this way are sacrificed at the same time.

If you cast this as a spell, you choose how many and which creatures to devour as part of the resolution of that spell. (It can't be countered at this point.) The same is true of a spell or ability that lets you put a creature with devour onto the battlefield.

The number of Saproling tokens created by the triggered ability is based on the number of +1/+1 counters on Mycoloth, not on the number of creatures Mycoloth devoured. It doesn't matter where the +1/+1 counters came from.
You may choose not to sacrifice any creatures for the Devour ability.

You may sacrifice only creatures that are already on the battlefield. If a creature with devour and another creature are entering under your control at the same time, the creature with devour can't devour that other creature. The creature with devour also can't devour itself.

mainBoard.text:
Devour 2 (As this enters, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each +1/+1 counter on Mycoloth.

mainBoard.name: Nest Invader

mainBoard.text: When Nest Invader enters, create a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."

mainBoard.flavorText: "Our unity unmasks your deceit."

rulings.text: You can’t activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least two cards in their graveyard to target.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

Reach

Whenever Preyseizer Dragon attacks, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Preyseizer Dragon.

rulings.text: Preyseizer Dragon’s ability counts the number of +1/+1 counters on it when the ability resolves. It counts any +1/+1 counters, not just ones put on it due to devour.

{G}: Thorn-Thrash Viashino gains trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Thromok the Insatiable
mainBoard.originalText: Devour X, where X is the number of creatures devoured this way (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it for each of those creatures.)

rulings.text: For example, if Thromok devours one creature, it will enter with one +1/+1 counter on it. If it devours two creatures, it will enter with two +1/+1 counters for each of them, for a total of four +1/+1 counters. Devouring three creatures will produce nine +1/+1 counters, and so on.

mainBoard.text: Devour X, where X is the number of creatures devoured this way (As this enters, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters with X +1/+1 counters on it for each of those creatures.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Just when you thought you'd be safe, in the middle of an open field with no Eldrazi around for miles.
mainBoard.name: Hellion Eruption
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice all creatures you control, then put that many 4/4 red Hellion creature tokens onto the battlefield.
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice all creatures you control, then create that many 4/4 red Hellion creature tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText: The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.
mainBoard.name: Mark of Mutiny
mainBoard.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: Mark of Mutiny can target any creature, even one that you already control or that is already untapped.
The +1/+1 counter remains on the creature after the control-changing effect ends.

mainBoard.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Nature doesn't walk.
mainBoard.name: Overrun
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won’t affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

mainBoard.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.
mainBoard.name: Fiery Conclusion
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Fiery Conclusion, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.

rulings.text: Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: About halfway to the target, Snukk vowed that he had been tricked for the last time.
mainBoard.name: Fling
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to interfere with the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you can't cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can't sacrifice additional creatures.
Use the sacrificed creature's power as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how much damage Fling deals.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.

mainBoard.name: Flayer Husk

rulings.text: If the Germ token is destroyed, the Equipment remains on the battlefield as with any other Equipment.

If the living weapon trigger causes two Germs to be created (due to an effect such as that of Doubling Season), the Equipment becomes attached to one of them. The other will be put into your graveyard and subsequently cease to exist, unless another effect raises its toughness above 0.

Like other Equipment, each Equipment with living weapon has an equip cost. You can pay this cost to attach an Equipment to another creature you control. Once the Germ token is no longer equipped, it will be put into your graveyard and subsequently cease to exist, unless another effect raises its toughness above 0.

The Germ token enters the battlefield as a 0/0 creature and the Equipment becomes attached to it before state-based actions would cause the token to die. Abilities that trigger as the token enters the battlefield see that a 0/0 creature entered the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Thran learned to capture mana, but power inevitably escapes its bonds.
mainBoard.name: Fractured Powerstone
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Roll the planar die. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: In non-Planechase games, Fractured Powerstone's second ability will have no effect.

Rolling the planar die this way doesn't count when determining the cost of the special action of rolling the planar die. For example, if you roll the planar die twice in a turn, then activate Fractured Powerstone to roll it a third time, rolling the planar die again that turn will cost {2}.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Roll the planar die. Activate only as a sorcery.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may create a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."

mainBoard.originalText:

mainBoard.flavorText: "Listen to the roar! Feel the thunder! The Immersturm shouts its approval with every bolt of lightning!"
mainBoard.name: Warstorm Surge
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The creature that entered deals damage equal to its current power to the targeted permanent or player. If it's no longer on the battlefield, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

Warstorm Surge is the source of the ability, but the creature is the source of the damage. The ability couldn't target a creature with protection from red, for example. It could target a creature with protection from creatures, but all the damage would be prevented. Since damage is dealt by the creature, abilities like lifelink, deathtouch and infect are taken into account, even if the creature has left the battlefield by the time it deals damage.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a creature you control enters, it deals damage equal to its power to any target.
